definition[0]: to officially state something or say that rules, principles etc must be obeyed
example[0]: He had already clearly laid down his view in his opening speech.
example[1]: The contract laid down that the work must be completed before 2025.
definition[1]: if people lay down their weapons, they stop fighting
example[2]: The terrorists were urged to lay down their arms.
definition[2]: to tell other people what to do, how they should think etc, in a very strong or impolite way
example[3]: I could hear him laying down the law.
definition[3]: to die in order to help other people
example[4]: He was even prepared to lay down his life for his friends.
definition[4]: to store something, especially wine, to use in the future
definition[5]: to record your music, for example in a recording studio
example[5]: They are just about to start laying down tracks for their second album.
